TIDAL.Definition: affected by the rise and fall of the water that happens twice a day due to the effect of the moon

TIDE.Definition: the rise and fall of the sea or river that happens twice a day due to the effect of the moon

RUBBISH TIP.Definition: an area where people throw their rubbish or waste, refuse dump

SLAUGHTERHOUSES.Definition: places where animals were killed for their meat

FLUSHED OUT.Definition: led or driven by the water

FLUSHING.Definition: cleaned by causing large quantities of water to fall in them

OVERFLOW.Definition: be so full that the contents went over the sides

SEWERS.Definition: a system of underground pipes used to take waste away from one area to another

SEWER.Definition: the underground pipe used to take waste away from one area to another

DIARRHEA.Definition: watery and frequent flow of waste coming from the human body

PHYSICIAN.Definition: a doctor who has general medical skills

GET RID OF.Definition: be free of, do away with

FLUSH.Definition: lead or drive by using water

HEATWAVE.Definition: a period of very hot weather

FOR THAT MATTER.Definition: used to say that what is said about one thing is also true about something

PLEASURE CRUISE.Definition: a trip in a boat for pleasure

BOUQUET.Definition: a bunch of flowers arranged in a nice way

HANDKERCHIEFS.Definition: pieces of cloth or paper used for cleaning the nose or drying the eyes

BUBBLING.Definition: containing balls of gas or air (for a liquid)

RECLAIM.Definition: make it available for human use

RECLAIMED.Definition: made it available for human use

CONCRETE.Definition: a building material that becomes hard as a stone

FORESIGHT.Definition: ability to judge or predict correctly what would be needed in the future

UNPRECEDENTED.Definition: not having happened in the past

PUBLIC SERVANT.Definition: someone who worked for the state

HANDING OUT.Definition: giving a share of something, giving out

UNSUNG HEROES.Definition: people who provide great benefits but don't receive recognition or credit

TESTAMENT.Definition: something that serves as a sign or recognition of an important event
